title: Ziwiye
description: Ziwiye is the name of a modern village in northwestern Iran, associated with an archaeological site of the 7th century BCE that was looted in the mid-20th century and subsequently partially excavated in a more scientific manner. The site's ancient name is not known.

properties.description: Representative point location digitized from the Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World by the Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations project at Harvard University.
properties.title: DARMC location 22074
